name: mercurially
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that changes suddenly and often, in a way you do not expect: He is a tall, middle-aged man with a mercurially expressive face. She disappeared from Michael's life as mercurially as she had entered it.
More examplesFewer examplesThe music evolves mercurially from one thrilling section to another, changing direction with hardly a moment's notice.He is less mercurially quick than he was when he first joined the jazz world, but his sound is still magnificent.She gave a mercurially emotional performance of the role that left even her critics delighted.
